DOCNAME: CASE OF YANKOV AND OTHERS v. BULGARIA
JUDGES: Ganna Yudkivska;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE , CARDINAL , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively and live in the village of GPE near GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the second , third , fourth and fifth applicants and the son of the second and third applicants , PERSON , were caught by the police when attempting to transport stolen fruit . The police officers ordered the second applicant who was driving the cart with the stolen goods to bring the goods to the police station . He did not comply and drove the cart away . The remaining applicants and Mr R.R. went home .

CARDINAL . On DATE the third and fourth applicants and Mr R.R. were questioned in connection to the theft , admitted to it and stated that the fifth applicant had also participated in the theft . The second applicant was questioned and confessed to the offence on DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP Apparently these questionings were carried within the framework of police investigation ( дознание ) no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE a police officer from the GPE district police department proposed to the prosecution authorities to initiate preliminary investigation ( предварително производство ) for theft against the second , third , fourth and fifth applicants and Mr R.R. He stated in his report that the fifth applicant had not been questioned as he was hiding .
CARDINAL . Thereafter the case remained dormant until DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE a witness was questioned and on DATE an expert opinion was commissioned .

CARDINAL . On DATE the second , third , fourth and fifth applicants and PERSON ORG were questioned as suspects ( уличени ) under police investigation no . DATE and were charged with theft on the basis of the materials from that police investigation .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the case was brought to ORG , which on DATE remitted it back to the prosecution authorities because of procedural breaches .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date thereafter the charges against Mr R.R. were dropped .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE or DATE the case was again brought to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the second , third , fourth and fifth applicants concluded a plea bargain agreement and were sentenced to DATE imprisonment suspended for DATE . On DATE the agreement was approved by ORG .
CARDINAL . The first applicant did not take part in the above events and was never a party to the criminal proceedings .
